description: A cohort available in the beacon.

cohortType.description: Cohort type by its definition. If a cohort is declared ´study-defined´ or ´beacon-defined´ criteria are to be entered in cohort_inclusion_criteria; if a cohort is declared ‘user-defined' cohort_inclusion_criteria could be automatically populated from the parameters used to perform the query.

id.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

CURIE.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

cohortId.description: Cohort identifier. For ´study-defined´ or ´beacon-defined´cohorts this field is set by the implementer. For ´user-defined´ this unique identifier could be generated upon the query that defined the cohort, but could be later edited by the user.

cohortName.description: Name of the cohort. For ´user-defined´ this field could be generated upon the query, e.g. a value that is a concatenationor some representation of the user query.

cohortInclusionCriteria.description: Criteria used for defining the cohort. It is assumed that all cohort participants will match or NOT match such criteria.

locations.description: Geographic location(s) in cohort inclusion criteria

id.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

items.title: Disease
items.description: Diseases diagnosed e.g. to an individual, defined by diseaseID, age of onset, stage, level of severity, outcome and the presence of family history.

id.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

CURIE.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

iso8601duration.description: Represents age as a ISO8601 duration (e.g., P40Y10M05D).

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

CURIE.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

id.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

CURIE.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

familyHistory.description: Boolean indicating determined or self-reported presence of family history of the disease.

notes.description: Unstructured text to describe additional properties of this disease instance.

phenotypicConditions.description: Phenotypic condition(s) in cohort inclusion criteria

items.title: PhenotypicFeature
items.description: Used to describe a phenotype that characterizes the subject or biosample.

id.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

CURIE.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

excluded.description: (from Phenopackets v.2) Flag to indicate whether the disease was observed or not. Default is ‘false’, in other words the disease was observed. Therefore it is only required in cases to indicate that the disease was looked for, but found to be absent. More formally, this modifier indicates the logical negation of the OntologyClass used in the 'featureType' field. CAUTION It is imperative to check this field for correct interpretation of the disease!

modifiers.description: For instance one or more terms from HPO Clinical Modifier (HP:0012823). This subontology is designed to provide terms to characterize and specify the phenotypic abnormalities defined in the Phenotypic abnormality subontology, with respect to severity, laterality, age of onset, and other aspects. [ HPO:probinson ]

cohortSize.description: Count of unique Individuals in cohort (individuals meeting criteria for ´user-defined´ cohorts). If not previously known, it could be calculated by counting the individuals in the cohort.

eventNum.description: cardinality of the collection event / data point in a series

eventTimeline.description: Aggregated information of dates of visit/diagnostic/inclusion in study obtained from individual level info in database. Will coincide with collection event date for multi-time

eventSize.description: Count of individuals in cohort at data point (for ´user-defined´ cohorts, this is individuals meeting criteria) obtained from individual level info in database.

eventLocations.description: Aggregated information of geographic location obtained from individual level info in database.

distribution.description: List of categories and results or counts for each category.
